content:
Trigger Actions with the Toggle Element on a FlexCard

You can trigger an action when a user clicks a toggle element on a FlexCard. Let a user pick between two states, enable or disable an option, or select multiple options. When a user selects the element, its value is sent as a parameter to the action as true or false, or a comma-separated list of user-selected options with the {element.value} merge field.

You can also update the data source with the selected value of the Toggle element for all toggle types except Checkbox Group and Checkbox Group Button.

Beginning Winter '22, access the Toggle element from the Inputs section of the Build panel. Before Winter '22, access it from the Build panel.

To configure the toggle element:

Drag a Toggle element into a state on the canvas.
(Optional) Update the element name in the Element Name field.
From the Toggle Type dropdown, select the type of toggle element to use.
Configure the selected toggle type.
Bind the value of the toggle element to a data field with a boolean (true or false) value by clicking into Checked and selecting a merge field.

To configure action properties:

Click Add Action.
Enter any name in the Key field for input parameters.
Enter {element.value} in the Value field.
Pass the toggle element's value as a parameter to an action without input parameters, such as a Navigate action.

(Optional) To add conditions that must be met for the element to display, see Add Conditions to a FlexCard Element.
(Optional) To style your element, click Style to open the Style panel, and see Style FlexCard Elements.
title: Triggering Actions with Toggle Elements in FlexCards
